summary: This is an FBI interview summary (FD-302) of Alfredo Rodriguez, former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on November 5, 2009. Rodriguez describes his role in making payments to girls, details the sexual activity and presence of underage girls at Epstein's Palm Beach home, and discusses the seizure of a 'black bound book' and handwritten notes containing names and contacts.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein, interviewee
persons.context: Former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein from 2004-2005. Interviewed by the FBI, he describes making payments to girls, cleaning up after sexual massages, and possessing Epstein's 'black bound book' and handwritten notes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as Rodriguez's former employer. Rodriguez states Epstein would instruct him to withdraw funds from the bank to pay girls and describes sexual activity with young girls occurring at his Palm Beach home.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Rodriguez states Maxwell told him not to discuss what occurred at Epstein's home after he was fired. She also instructed him on whom to pay and in what amount.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: An attorney who contacted Rodriguez concerning legal representation after Rodriguez alerted Epstein's organization about a subpoena in civil litigation. Rodriguez declined his representation.

persons.name: Leslie Lnu
persons.context: A secretary in New York for Epstein's organization whom Rodriguez contacted in 2005 regarding a letter of reference and again in early 2009 after receiving a subpoena.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Rodriguez states Brunel would bring girls to Epstein's house and arrange for girls to be flown in via commercial and private planes.

persons.name: Valsoun Lnu
persons.context: Described as the house manager of Epstein's Paris, France property. Rodriguez discussed the sexual activity with young girls with him.

persons.name: Jerome Pierre
persons.context: The gardener at Epstein's Palm Beach property. Rodriguez believed he was aware of the sexual activity with young girls at the house.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager for Epstein from 2004-2005.
Rodriguez received instructions from Maxwell regarding payments to girls and was told by her not to discuss activities at Epstein's home after his termination.
Both instructed Rodriguez on financial and logistical matters related to the girls. Maxwell acted on Epstein's behalf.
Brunel brought girls to Epstein's house and arranged transportation for them, indicating a logistical connection in the procurement of girls.
Goldberger contacted Rodriguez offering legal representation after Rodriguez alerted Epstein's organization about a subpoena.
Both were staff at Epstein's Palm Beach property. Rodriguez believed Pierre was aware of the sexual activity.

events.title: Seizure of Black Book and Notes
events.description: FBI agents seized a black bound book and handwritten notes from Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Rodriguez Fired by Epstein
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez was fired from his position as house manager for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Interview of Rodriguez
events.description: The FBI interviewed Alfredo Rodriguez, who waived his rights and provided detailed information about activities at Epstein's home.

events.title: Hurricane Computer Repairs
events.description: After hurricanes in 2004 or 2005, a computer technician from Ohio performed repair or maintenance on computers at Epstein's home, which contained pornographic images.

events.title: Regular Sexual Activity at Epstein Home
events.description: Rodriguez describes massages occurring twice daily, followed by cleanup of sex toys, handcuffs, and used condoms.

locations: Belvedere Road and U.S. Highway 1, Palm Beach county (taxi company area)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, possessed a 'black bound book' and handwritten notes with names/contacts of girls, which the FBI seized on November 3, 2009.
Rodriguez described making cash payments to girls on instructions from Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell, after withdrawing specified amounts from the bank.
Rodriguez reported seeing photographs of naked underage girls in collages in Epstein's home, naked underage girls at the pool, and pornographic images on computers in the house.
Rodriguez and a housekeeper cleaned massage areas, which included cleaning massage tables, sex toys, handcuffs, and disposing of used condoms, with massages often occurring twice daily.
Rodriguez stated that Ghislaine Maxwell told him not to discuss what occurred at Epstein's home approximately 3-4 months after he was fired in March 2005.
